subject: ISME
title: Project Mgmt
info: broad areas in project management/leadership. emphasizes practical understanding of business/engineering project management. project planning, scheduling, controlling. budgeting, staffing, task/cost control. communicating with, motivating, leading, managing conflict.
prereqInfo: open to general grad students but with instr consent

subject: ISME
title: Construction Estimating
info: methods for quantity take-offs. identification of resources for price/availability information.

subject: ISME
title: Comp Appl II
info: application features in  excel, visual basic, and web authoring. data reduction, data presentation, interactive web calculations. student projects.

subject: ISME
title: ISE Management
info: managing public works infrastructure. case studies of decision making in environment of conflicting interests.

subject: ISME
title: Computer Applications/ISE
info: advanced application of computer tools/methods in infrastructure engineering problems. spreadsheet visual basic programming, html, java script.

subject: ISME
title: Pavement Mgmt/Maint/Rehab
info: concepts in network/project level pavement management for flexible/rigid pavements. pavement distress identification/quantification. functional/structural evaluation. identification of appropriate maintenance activities. selection/design of rehabilitation alternatives.

subject: ISME
title: Pavmnt Mgmt & Rehab
info: concepts in network/project-level pavement management for flexible/rigid pavements. pavement distress identification/quantification. functional/structural evaluation. identification of appropriate preventative/reactive maintenance activities. selection/design of rehabilitation alternatives.

subject: ISME
title: Traffic Eng Mgmt
info: identification and effective use of traffic control devices. automated method of characterizing/assessing traffic flow. evaluation/improvement of geometric features.

subject: ISME
title: BridgeMgmtMaint&Rehab
info: structural/functional evaluation of steel, concrete, and timber bridges.  distress identification. modes of failure, including fatigue, corrosion, and foundation erosion (scour). preventative/reactive maintenance techniques. rehabilitation design/construction.

subject: ISME
title: Critical Infrast Secur & Prot
info: security challenges of protecting critical infrastructure, facilities, and built environment. security, agility, and robustness/survivability of large-scale critical infrastructure that face new threats and unanticipated conditions. systems risk analysis, engineering, economics, and public policy approaches to infrastructure security. design/management of complex civil infrastructure systems.
prereqInfo: ise grad student or instr consent

subject: ISME
title: Water Dist Sys
info: components/design of water distribution systems. methods of evaluation/management. maintenance/rehabilitation techniques.

subject: ISME
title: Storm Water Mgmt
info: components/design of storm water collection systems. methods of evaluation/management. maintenance/rehabilitation techniques.

subject: ISME
title: Water Treat Syst
info: components/design of water treatment systems. evaluation/management methods. maintenance/rehabilitation techniques.

subject: ISME
title: Public Interactions
info: techniques for effective public communication. how to run public hearing. resources for publishing public notices. sequence course in three parts.
prereqInfo: advanced grad student or open to general grad students with instr consent

subject: ISME
title: GIS
info: introduction to geographic information systems (gis) for infrastructure.  gis application domains, data models/sources, analysis methods, and output techniques. lectures, readings, hands-on experience with gis software.

subject: ISME
title: Fin Mgmt in Pulic Org
info: design, installation, and use of accounting/control systems in public organizations. public accounting standards/practices, financial administration, financial reporting, debt management, budgeting, and contract/procurement management systems. lecture, discussion, case analysis.

subject: ISME
title: Const Law & Ethcs
info: ethical framework for responsible management of public works projects. moral leadership, trust in public/private organizations, quality control.

subject: ISME
title: Capstone Project
info: integrates knowledge from courses in master's program with job experience. students prepare proposal, conduct project, and report results in written and oral form. project involves aspect of design, management, or operation of some feature of infrastructure.

subject: ISME
title: FTE: Master's
prereqInfo: master's student, adviser approval, dgs approval.
